pages.title: Processor Unit
pages.text: The silicon heart of your operations. The Processor Unit is the primary component responsible for generating $(l:logicore:architecture/cycles)Cycles$().$(br)$(br)It must be installed in $(l:logicore:machines/server_rack)Server Racks$() or $(l:logicore:machines/computer)Computers$(). Without a processor, these machines are inertâ€”producing nothing even if connected to power.

pages.title: Operational Control
pages.text: Machines equipped with a Processor Unit are $(l)redstone sensitive$().$(br)$(br)Applying a redstone signal acts as a hardware interrupt. The machine will immediately cease all operations, halting $(l:logicore:architecture/cycles)Cycle$() production and stopping energy consumption. This is useful for automating power efficiency.
Precision engineering is required to turn raw silicon into a functional logic gate array.
